alert.note: Alert for Inland Collier County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Collier County through 500 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Big Cypress National Preserve, or 15 miles northeast of Chokoloskee, moving south at 5 to 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Cypress National Preserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
